org.firmata4j.fsm

Class FiniteStateMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firmata4j.fsm.FiniteStateMachine

  • public class FiniteStateMachine
extends Object
    Finite State Machine base implementation.
    The finite state machine is not thread-safe by its nature. This implementation does not cope with simultaneously received bytes. The bytes have to be fed to the FSM one by one in a single thread that should define the order the bytes go in.
    Author:
    Oleg Kurbatov <o.v.kurbatov@gmail.com>

        public static final String FSM_IS_IN_TERMINAL_STATE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FiniteStateMachine

        public FiniteStateMachine()
        Constructs the finite state machine in the terminal state, i.e. without any particular current state. So that it will do noting on process(byte) method invocation until a state will be set using transitTo(org.firmata4j.fsm.State).

      • FiniteStateMachine

        public FiniteStateMachine(Class<? extends State> stateClass)
        Constructs the finite state machine in the state of the specified class.
        Parameters:
        stateClass - the class of initial state of the FSM
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when creating of the state instance is impossible (likely because of lack of the constructor taking the FSM as a parameter)

    • Method Detail

      • setEventHandlingExecutor

        public void setEventHandlingExecutor(Executor executor)
        Assigns an executor responsible for performing event hanling.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor that will perform event handling

      • transitTo

        public void transitTo(State state)
        Transfers the FSM to the new state.
        Parameters:
        state - the new state

      • transitTo

        public void transitTo(Class<? extends State> stateClass)
        Transfers the FSM to the new state of the specified class.
        This method takes only classes that provide a constructor taking a FiniteStateMachine instance as a parameter. The IllegalArgumentException is thrown otherwise.
        Parameters:
        stateClass - the state class
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the state class does not provide a constructor taking FiniteStateMachine instance as a single parameter.

      • getCurrentState

        public State getCurrentState()
        Returns current state of the FSM.
        Returns:
        the current state

      • process

        public void process(byte b)
        Hands the byte to be processed with the current state.
        Parameters:
        b - input byte

      • process

        public void process(byte[] buffer)
        Hands bytes from the buffer to be processed by the current state sequentially.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the bytes to be processed

      • process

        public void process(byte[] buffer,
                    int offset,
                    int length)
        Hands bytes from the buffer to be processed by the current state sequentially.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the bytes to be processed
        offset - the index of the first byte to process
        length - the number of the bytes to be processed

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(String eventType,
                       Consumer<Event> handler)
        Adds a handler for specified event type. If there already is aanother handler for that event type, this handler gets added to the end of handler chain.
        Parameters:
        eventType - type of event the handler is supposed to deal with
        handler - an object that gets an event to process

      • handle

        public void handle(Event event)
        Handles an event that occurs during processing of the input.
        The method is invoked by the current state of FSM when an event occurs.
        Parameters:
        event - the event
